perturbation.original_text: The Covenanter: The HUANG JIA Country CLUB and Recreation Inc. (hereinafter referred to as Party A) and the Covenanter: Chang Chen- Bin Architects Office (hereinafter referred to as Party B) hereby agree to establish the following terms and conditions with regard to the development of Miaoli Royal Resort Hotel:
perturbation.changed_text: The Covenanter: The HUANG JIA Country CLUB and Recreation Inc. (hereinafter referred to as Party A) and the Service Provider: Chang Chen- Bin Architects Office (hereinafter referred to as Party B) hereby agree to establish the following terms and conditions with regard to the development of Miaoli Royal Resort Hotel:
perturbation.explanation: The term 'Covenanter' is replaced with 'Service Provider' when referring to Party B. This introduces inconsistency as Party A is still referred to as 'Covenanter,' potentially creating confusion about the exact legal role and obligations of Party B compared to Party A.
perturbation.location: Beginning of the contract, before Article I

perturbation.original_text: Article IX. Duties of Party B I. Party B shall follow all instructions of Party A and ensure all plans and designs of the project to meet relevant construction laws and regulations. II. Party B shall take on a professional attitude for various services mentioned in Article III of the Contract, maintain benefits and interests of Party A all the time and adopt the most economical option under the precondition of safety and reliability. III. Party B is obligatory to report the latest progress and completed content to Party A.
perturbation.changed_text: Article IX. Duties of the Architect Office I. Party B shall follow all instructions of Party A and ensure all plans and designs of the project to meet relevant construction laws and regulations. II. The Architect Office shall take on a professional attitude for various services mentioned in Article III of the Contract, maintain benefits and interests of Party A all the time and adopt the most economical option under the precondition of safety and reliability. III. Party B is obligated to report the latest progress and completed content to Party A.
perturbation.explanation: Party B is inconsistently referred to as 'Party B' and 'The Architect Office' within the same section, creating uncertainty. While it's likely Party B is the Architect Office, failing to consistently use the same term could lead to ambiguity in interpretation and enforcement.

perturbation.original_text: Article IV. Service Fee The fees for services mentioned in Part I to Part VI are NTD 12 million ((SAY TWELVE MILLION ONLY) in total and the fees for planning and design of the buildings and construction monitoring shall be calculated based on the ratio of 3.50% of the legal construction cost hereof. Should Party A require a comprehensive modification on the development plan of the project outsourced and any subsequent extra cost occur in Party B; Party A shall bear the corresponding extra service fee.
perturbation.changed_text: Article IV. Compensation The fees for services mentioned in Part I to Part VI are NTD 12 million ((SAY TWELVE MILLION ONLY) in total and the fees for planning and design of the buildings and construction monitoring shall be calculated based on the ratio of 3.50% of the legal construction cost hereof. Should Party A require a comprehensive modification on the development plan of the project outsourced and any subsequent extra cost occur in the Design Firm; Party A shall bear the corresponding extra compensation.
perturbation.explanation: The term 'Service Fee' is replaced with 'Compensation' and 'Party B' is replaced with 'Design Firm' in the same paragraph. Itâ€™s unclear whether 'Compensation' and 'Service Fee' are the same, and whether 'Party B' and 'Design Firm' refers to the same entity which could lead to potential disputes about fees and obligations.
